titleStmt.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter, February 10, 1887

bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Mr. S. S. Sevier
To the Ass't Secretary of State
Receipt of Cable Despatch. Bond Forwarded.

Hon. Jas. D. Porter
Ass't Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor to inform you that your "Cable Despatch" sent to "Goree-Dakar" in order to reach me was received on the 7 of Feb'y 1887 after many days delay owing to the mail steamers which only stop at this port twice a month. I herewith inclose my
my bond, and would have sent it some time ago; but I thought it was not in my power to do so unless a regular appointed Minister was present to certify, I hope no harm will result from my delay.

Please intercede that I be detained during the two years administration of his excellency President Cleveland and I shall do my duty to the best of my ability. I hope my Bond will meet your
your approval.

I am, Sir,
Your obedient servant
Samuel S. Sevier
Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
div1.fw:
Hon. Jas. D. Porter
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

div1.p: Bond on the way. Have me detained. Term out.
